intro: Psychotria crassifolia var. crassifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that are typically followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and chemical composition, it has been of interest in both botanical and ethnobotanical studies.
